result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan P. Wermuth

records.addlTxt: Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.

2:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dylan P. Wermuth appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Janae F. Hochmuth appeared by video for Dylan P. Wermuth.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $250 cash bond per case.  Atty Hochmuth requests a signature bond or no more than $50 cash.  $100.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No possession or use of any controlled substances without a valid Rx.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.
